intro: Wahlenbergia pendula, commonly known as the weeping bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, oval leaves that are opposite along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Wahlenbergia pendula is often grown as a decorative plant in gardens due to its ornamental flowers and cascading form.
